entry.title: SEC Chair Issues Dire Warning For Crypto Exchanges
entry.summary:
Gary Gensler, chairman of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), continues to crack down on the crypto industry. In an investor advisory committee, the SEC Chair declared that lending platforms and crypto exchanges operate ‚Äúinvestment advisers can‚Äôt rely on them as qualified custodians.‚Äù Gensler added:
Just because a crypto trading platform claims to be a qualified custodian doesn‚Äôt mean that it is. When these platforms fail- something we‚Äôve seen time and again ‚Äî investors‚Äô assets often have become property of the failed company, leaving investors in line at the bankruptcy court.
For Gensler, advisers should comply with the current custody rule, which requires that investors‚Äô funds and securities be held with ‚Äúqualified custodians.‚Äù These qualified custodians, which Gensle‚Ä¶

The original Treasury report released in September 2022 described the formation of a CBDC working group that would advance work on a CBDC. entry.title: Bitcoin Rally Hits Equity-Driven ‚ÄúRoadblock,‚Äù Here‚Äôs What Happens When It‚Äôs Broken
entry.summary:
Cycle expert Bob Loukas recently shared a long-term look at Bitcoin which suggests that the top cryptocurrency is ready for another bullish trend. However, an equity-driven ‚Äúroadblock‚Äù remains in the way.
In this post, we‚Äôll explain what Loukas means and what could happen once this roadblock is cleared.
Bob Loukas: ‚ÄúCut Out The Noise And Widen The Lens‚Äù
Entrepreneur, investor, and position trader Bob Loukas tweeted a new chart this week with a zoomed out one-month view of BTCUSD.
‚ÄúImagine being scared-worried after looking at this Bitcoin monthly chart,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúCut out the noise and widen the lens,‚Äù he added.
Loukas is hinting at a cyclical turning point in the cryptocurrency market. BTCUSD has retested and reclaimed a former resistance line now possibly turned support, and ‚Ä¶

entry.title: HSBC, Nationwide Banks Crack Down On Bitcoin And Crypto Access
entry.summary: Two of the U.K.‚Äôs largest banks have imposed further restrictions on their customers‚Äô ability to acquire cryptocurrencies. British banks have continued to crack down on their customers' cryptocurrency purchases. According to a Bloomberg report, Nationwide and HSBC are the latest U.K. banking giants to impose new limits on their customer‚Äôs cryptocurrency purchases via debit cards and end purchases with credit cards. ‚ÄúNationwide is applying daily limits of ¬£5,000 ($5,965) on debit-card purchases of cryptoassets, the building society informed customers on Wednesday, while its credit cards can no longer be used to buy crypto. HSBC said it barred customers from making crypto purchases via its credit cards from last month,‚Äù reads the report. HSBC states that the decision is due to alleged financial risk to customers. The report describes how ‚ÄúMost of the major [U.K.] banks have also implemented exchange-specific restrictions, with the world‚Äôs largest crypto platform Binance Holdings Ltd. the most popular target.‚Äù Bitcoin Magazine covered the start of these moves from U.K. banks in tandem with increasing discussion of a U.K. CBDC. Alison Rose, CEO of NatWest Group, described how the bank had taken a ‚Äúpretty hard line‚Äù on cryptocurrency due to the instability and volatility of the platforms and the risk of fraud, citing social media and technology platforms as the fraud‚Äôs primary source. These new limitations on customers places U.K. citizens at a further disadvantage in regards to acquiring bitcoin. As such developments are taking place, it highlights the need for more decentralized, peer-to-peer exchanges that can facilitate no-KYC bitcoin transactions.

entry.title: Binance Announces Support For New African Currencies Without Third Parties
entry.summary: Users from Liberia, Sierra Leone and more can now directly utilize their local currencies to buy and sell bitcoin through Binance P2P. Cryptocurrency platform Binance has announced that its peer-to-peer (P2P) marketplace will now support more African currencies, including Liberian dollar (LRD), Sierra Leonean leone (SLL), Gambian dalasi (GMD), Mauritanian ouguiya (MRO), and Cape Verdean escudo (CVE).¬† Users in these regions can now transact with other users in their local currencies without a third party or intermediary. Users can also trade and post trade advertisements in the newly supported currencies or directly trade BTC with other users at zero fees. Director for Binance in West and East Africa, Nadeem Anjarwalla, said, ‚ÄúBinance has continued to remain committed to increasing the adoption and mainstream accessibility of crypto, and we are excited to be taking this step in making access to digital assets effortless for more Africans." In addition, users who frequently receive cryptocurrencies, as well as LRD, SLL, GMD, MRO, and CVE, can now become merchants on Binance P2P. According to the press release, this will enable them to receive exclusive customer support, verified badges and access to advanced trading tools. Merchants also enjoy VIP discounts and zero fees on the platform. To apply, users can visit the Binance P2P website. By providing access to broad financial tools while maintaining one of the lowest fees in the business, Binance aims to make crypto accessible to everyone in Africa and beyond.

entry.summary:
PRESS RELEASE. Aurora Cloud is the all-in-one cloud infrastructure solution bridging Web2 and Web3.
03/02/2023 Denver ‚Äì Web3 infrastructure startup Aurora Labs announced the launch of Aurora Cloud, a platform and suite of products that allows today‚Äôs Web2 businesses to capture the value of Web3.
Aurora Cloud ‚Äî Platforms like Amazon AWS and Microsoft Azure unleashed the potential of Web2 by democratizing the building blocks of the internet. In a similar way, Aurora Cloud ‚Äî including Borealis Business, Aurora Pass and Aurora Silos ‚Äî eliminates the technical and user experience barriers that keep Web2 businesses from capturing the full value of Web3.
The foundation of Aurora Cloud is Aurora, the innovative blockchain that provides full Ethereum compatibility, while leveraging the speed,‚Ä¶

entry.summary: ‚ÄúAvalon‚Äù aims to be a AAA interoperable gameworld with blockchain elements.

entry.title: NFT Games 'Aren't Just About Minting': WorldWide Webb Founder
entry.summary: The gaming community hasn't shown much affection for NFTs, but the Worldwide Webb founder thinks that could soon change.

entry.title: Term Labs Raises $2.5M to Build Out Fixed-Rate Product for DeFi
entry.summary: Term Labs is building out a key primitive for the DeFi space, allowing crypto projects to lock in fixed rates on their idle holdings.

entry.title: Ethereum Edges Closer to Letting Users Withdraw Staked ETH
entry.summary: Sepolia is the second Ethereum testnet to see a dress rehearsal for Shanghai, which will finally let users withdraw their staked ETH.

entry.title: TeraWulf‚Äôs Nuclear Bitcoin Plant Is Just One Piece of the Green Mining Puzzle
entry.summary: Terawulf‚Äôs newest nuclear-powered Bitcoin miner in Pennsylvania isn‚Äôt the firm‚Äôs first attempt at going green.

entry.title: Yat Siu of Animoca Brands: 'The Future of Crypto and Web3 Is Culture'
entry.summary: Animoca Brands chairman Yat Siu spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the open metaverse, NFTs and gaming, building through a bear market, and why Animoca believes the future of the industry is culture and gaming.

entry.title: COO of Move-to-Earn App STEPN: 'We're Thriving, Not Just Surviving'
entry.summary: Shiti Manghani, COO of Stepn, the app that lets users earn tokens for exercising, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about Stepn's current health, its plans to addnew achievement systems for the top users, and parent company Finding Satoshi Labs and its plans to launch more apps.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygon‚Äôs Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industry‚Äôs rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event
entry.summary: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesn‚Äôt Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
